alert.note: Alert for Custer; Keith; Lincoln; McPherson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 7:36PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Keith, northern Lincoln, south central McPherson and southwestern Custer Counties through 815 PM CDT/715 PM MDT/... At 736 PM CDT/636 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Maxwell to near Sutherland. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Platte, Sutherland, Hershey, Brady, Maxwell, Sutherland Reservoir State Recreation Area, Lake Maloney State Recreation Area, North Platte Airport, Keith, Cottonwood Canyon State Wildlife Management Area, Etna, Coker, Jeffrey Canyon State Wildlife Management Area, O`Fallons, Birdwood and Vroman. This includes the following highways... Highway 97 between mile markers 1 and 17. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 148 and 207. Highway 83 between mile markers 73 and 104. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT/700 PM MDT/ for central, southwestern and west central Nebraska.
